reviewText: I love both these movies. I bought this for "For a Few Dollars More", my favorite of the three Clint Eastwood spaghetti westerns. This 2-movie box set was less expensive than the one movie alone. I just wish "The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly" could have also been included.
Very good movie yhat i would watch over and over

Great movies, the movies get 5 stars.  I saw them originally at a drive in theater so it brings back memories of a time when Rawhide's star (Clint) stepped onto the big screen for the first time and blew us all away (along with several bad guys). The Blu-ray isn't as good as I hoped, it is a little grainy in parts, so I removed one star,  but it's the best copy I've seen so far, and it is worth the low price I paid. Blu-rays don't scratch as easily as DVDs do, so I got it used at a low price, and it was in great shape.

previous review incorrect - although other menu options appear to be grayed out, they are actually accessible - so the disks do include chapters, options, and extras! well worth the inexpensive price you can grab a used one for.

Seems OK. MGM library edition. Two 40+ GB disks.
Only option on Main Menu is 'Play': Chapters/Setup/Extras dimmed out.
English SDH/Spanish/French available via player remote.
(<$8 @ walmart)
